description.en: Course is dedicated to close readings and discussions of texts by Jakob von Uexküll and Juri Lotman and other key authors forming the tradition of Tartu semiotics. Seminars are introduced by lectures providing intellectual and historical context.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to provide a thorough overview of the, ideas, concepts and most important writings of the semiotic thinkers who have had close relationships with Estonia and form the basis for the current Tartu semiotics and its developments.

independent_work.et:
* a final essay with the application of the introduced concepts (7-8 pg, 12 pt), should include
-the explication of the original meaning of the concepts and their context
-the inclusion of some relevant modern elaborations of the concept
-an empirical application of the concept
(80%)
* answering the questions based on the texts (Moodle submissions) and/or participation in class  groupwork tasks
(20%)
The assessment methods are specified with students in the beginning of the course.

grade_preconditions.et: participation in seminar discussions and submission of responses to seminar assignments

grade_evaluation.et: The final result will be formed by the final essay (80%) and seminar assignments (20%)

debt_elimination.et: Assignments need to be completed on time (due dates will be specified at the beginning of the semester). Late assignments will be graded down one point per day. Extension of deadlines is possible in case of compelling reasons (illness etc.), of which please let us know as soon as possible (riin.magnus@ut.ee; elin.sytiste@ut.ee).

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
